intro: Senecio blumei, commonly known as the Blume's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces small yellow flowers that are clustered in dense, spherical heads. Senecio blumei is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and drought tolerance.
